admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
This overview is based on the Project
            Completion Report for the Second Agricultural Credit Project
            in Thailand. The main objectives of the Second Agricultural
            Credit Project were to: (a) improve the financial viability
            of the Bank for Agriculture and Agricultural Cooperatives
            (BAAC) and reduce its dependence on subsidies; (b) increase
            BAAC's incentive to mobilize rural savings; and (c)
            improve BAAC's role in providing credit to small
            farmers who could not qualify for commercial bank loans.
            Lessons learned from this project are as follows; (a) In
            reaching new high-risk segments of the market, it is
            essential that 'institutions like BAAC first design and
            implement a pilot project which, if successful, can be
            replicated more broadly. (b) The foreign exchange risk on
            foreign borrowings can be serious burden on an institution
            like BAAC, which is not allowed to charge commercial rates
            for its lending operations. In this regards, BAAC considers
            that it is incurring heavy foreign exchange losses because
            of this project and that is the main reason that, despite a
            very satisfactory working relationship, BAAC has thus far
            been unwilling to consider further borrowing from the World Bank.
